value: IST is the home of Turkish Airlines

Named after the founder of modern Turkey, Istanbul Atatürk Airport is located 20 km west of the country's largest city
. As Istanbul is situated partly in Europe and partly in Asia, it's the only major airport in the world that can be said to serve two continents.

value: It is no longer possible to purchase a visa on entering Turkey.

Visitors are required to purchase a visa in advance online at https://www.evisa.gov.tr/en/. (Do not use any other website, which will be unofficial and probably charge an excessive fee.)
IST is the main hub for the national carrier Turkish Airlines which is the world's 4th biggest carrier by number of destinations. Also Atlasjet, Freebird Airlines and Onur Air are based here.

Note that people are working on commission at the airport trying to make you use special shuttle buses for very high fees (30+ TL), so for people who wish to travel more economically the Metro/tram-combination is easy and fairly quick, and offers very good value.

If you are traveling on budget and plan to spend some time at the airport, it may be wise to bring your own meals from town instead of buying them there. If you come from the Metro, there is a supermarket in the tunnel leading to the elevators / stairs to the airport proper where you can do some last-minute shopping.

As at most airports, money exchange is more expensive than in the city.  In Istanbul the airport money exchange offices accept limited currencies.  It is recommended to bring US dollars or Euros for the best exchange rates.
